metadata.key: search:general:6:What are the key highlights of Pranjal Chalisr's life?

data.title: Pranjal Chalise: An Enthusiastic Technopreneur! - Glocal Teen Hero
data.snippet:
Pranjal has aided the Blind Community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps the blind community in currency bills recognition and cash transactions. By creating Kisan Nepal, a mobile application that offers agricultural news and information from reliable sources and keeps farmers informed and alert, he has helped to alleviate agricultural and farmer limitations. 

Currently, He is working as an incubator and app developer at Incubate Nepal. He is recognized as one of the brightest high school students (One of 20 selected students from all disciplines and one of 10 for Computer Science) from all over Nepal to work on open-end research projects under the mentorship of MIT and Harvard graduates. [...] Apart from that; He is the founder & Project Mentor of Students Research Council Nepal (SRCN), (an organization that provides the platform of research and project-based education to high-school enthusiasts and provides paper-writing and app development training). He finished the initial round of research and launched Gyan-E, Nepal‚Äôs first-ever discussion forum. They have guided 7 brilliant high schoolers under his mentorship. In the International Journal, SRCN has successfully published 4 research papers.

As a Computer Science Mentor, he taught coding and mobile app development to high school students. His work has been recognized by the Nepal Academy of Science and Technology for their efforts to introduce the concept of research and instill it in young students. [...] His another venture, ‚ÄòSurakshya Nepal‚Äô-Women Safety App, provides a practical and reasonable solution to women‚Äôs safety. He has put a lot of effort into developing a Women Safety App which sends SOS alert messages to the concerned authorities during the time of an emergency.  Also, Pranjal is generating ripple effects in the lives of students, farmers, organizations, differently-abled individuals, women, and gender equality by developing mobile applications. 

He established a non-profit tech venture ‚Äòe-educators Nepal‚Äô to enhance the quality of online education and ease the accessibility of educational resources. Through his tech venture; ‚Äòe-educators Nepal‚Äô is helping students to improve their academic performance and nurturing their self-learning processes.

data.title: Pranjal Chalise Felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
data.snippet:
Mr. Pranjal was selected among the Top Six Finalists of the competition viz Mr. Anurag Chapagain, (18 years, Youtuber, Nawalparasi); Mr. Deepak Sutihar (19 years, Social Entrepreneur, Saptari); Ms. Khusbu Bhandari, (18 years,Wildlife Conservationist, Chitwan); Ms. Neha Gurung, (19 years, Social Activist, Kathmandu); and Ms. Sabhya Rai, (19 years, Education Activist, IIam)

Mr. Pranjal Chalise has aided the Blind Community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps the blind community in currency bills recognition and cash transactions. [...] The conference started virtually on the 28thof Augustasan Opening Ceremony with the presence of guests and teenagers from different countries. Mr. Binod Das, as a Key Note Speaker encouraged the teenagers from different countries and urged them to word hard to achieve success in life.

The conference highlighted the ideas, experience, and stories of the teenagers from different countries like Nepal, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Mexico, USA, Philippines,Tunisia, and Liberia through series of panel discussions and presentations.The panel discussions were conducted on different topics like Entrepreneurship, Empowerment, and Socio-Perspective. [...] Likewise, He has developed a mobile application that provides agricultural news and information from authentic sources and another app includes-a Women Safety app to ensure the security of women and ensure they are not deprived of opportunities due to their safety reasons.

His other two educational apps have 7500 users. Pranjal has also initiated a non-profit tech venture E-educators Nepal‚Äô, which enhances the quality of online education and makes educational resources more accessible.

Furthermore, He is the member of the board of Initiative in Nepal Foundation, and currently working on a research paper about the Blockchain Technology and Smart Contracts and the ways in which technological advancement can mitigate the costs of elongated transaction processes.

data.title: Team Tumornators | An Incubate Nepal Project
data.snippet:
2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020)

‚ÄúA surreal utopia where friends turned into F.R.I.E.N.D.S, and fanatics into professionals. Contributing to two different teams- ‚ÄòTeam Kisan' and ‚ÄòTeam Drishti' was overwhelming but the realization that, through my projects, I could deliver ripple effects in the community- be it in the lives of farmers or differently-abled people, was certainly more promising. A bunch of high-school pass-outs coming together to create impacts on society sounds a bit fancy. At Incubate Nepal you'll witness countless such fancy sugarcoats turning into real-life realities.‚Äù

2020

## Anupa Khanal

Team Brahmanda(2020) [...] 2021

## Aayusha Dhungana

Team Samsad(2021)

‚ÄúPolitics and Social science, something that I was not really fond of. But to my own surprise, I was paired up with my team mates to build a website featuring parliament system of Nepal. Entering the whole new world of website building and politics surely frightened me, but the continuous support from the mentor and my wonderful team made this whole journey very smooth and informative. Incubate Nepal, helped me break my comforting cocoon and stand out in the crowd to learn, take challenges and share tons of memories with the whole team.‚Äù

2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020)

data.title: Pranjal Chalise - Peer Career Advisor at Amherst College | The Org
data.snippet:
# Pranjal Chalise

### Peer Career Advisor

Pranjal Chalise is a Software Engineer at Microsoft since June 2025, specializing in CoreAI. Concurrently, Pranjal serves as a Peer Career Advisor and a Peer Tutor in both the Math and Computer Science Departments at Amherst College, providing support for students in academic and professional development. Pranjal's prior experience includes working as an AI/ML Fellow and Software Engineer at Microsoft in 2024, and holding various roles at Amherst College such as Math & Stats Student Steering Committee Fellow and IT Specialist. Additionally, Pranjal contributed as a Research Assistant and Research Scholar at Incubate Nepal and is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science and Mathematics at Amherst College, expected to graduate in May 2026. [...] Log inSign up

data.title: Technopreneur Pranjal becomes Teen Hero Nepal 2021 - Mod Dhakal
data.snippet:
# Mod Dhakal

Freedom of expression is at the heart of human civilization!

## Saturday, September 4, 2021

### Technopreneur Pranjal becomes Teen Hero Nepal 2021

Kathmandu, Sept. 3

Pranjal Chalise, 19 years old Technopreneur from Kathmandu, has won the ‚ÄòWai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021‚Äô award.

The organiser Glocal Pvt. Ltd. organised a virtual award ceremony the other evening to announce the award.

Chalise was selected among the top six finanlists - Anurag Chapagain, 18, Youtuber, from Nawalparasi, Deepak Sutihar, 19, Social Entrepreneur from Saptari, Khusbu Bhandari, 18, Wildlife Conservationist from Chitwan, Neha Gurung, 19, Social Activist from Kathmandu and Sabhya Rai, 19, Education Activist from IIam. [...] Chalise has aided the blind community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps visually impaired people in currency bills recognition and cash transactions.

Likewise, he has developed a mobile application that provides agricultural news and information from authentic sources. His another app is a Women Safety app to ensure the security of women and ensure they are not deprived of opportunities due to their safety reasons.

His other two educational apps have 7,500 users.

Chalise has also initiated a non-profit tech venture E-educators Nepal, which enhances the quality of online education and makes educational resources more accessible. [...] ### Govt prepares primary draft of DRR Policy
